results.title: Sculpture
results.brief_description: Designed to show the power and beauty of some of Melbourne’s many sculptures from Dante in the Treasury Gardens to the striking figures of St George and the Dragon, and Joan of Arc in front of the State Library of Victoria. The effective soundtrack was arranged and played by Lenore Somerset.

results.title: Last resort
results.creator_credit: Robert Scarfe and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: An insight into the role and function of the Victorian Ombudsman through the dramatization of actual cases investigated by the Office. Includes an interview with the Ombudsman.

results.title: Casting iron plow-shares
results.creator_credit: Hermann Schlenker and International Film Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Mountain peoples of Central Asia”.
This film presents Tajik men of Afghanistan performing the several stages that shape, mould and cast, in wet sands, their iron plow-shares. It explains how over the centuries this ancient craft has achieved economy of action and perfect timing. No narration - traditional music accompaniament. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: Afghanistan, Pushtun people: making felt
results.creator_credit: Hermann Schlenker, Julien Bryan and International Film Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Mountain peoples of Central Asia”.
Shows how women of the Pushtun tribe make felt mats for their families and for decorating the hard floor of their black camel-hair tents. Suitable for upper primary, lower and middle secondary levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Hermann Schlenker, Julien Bryan and International Film Foundation

results.title: Boys' game: Pushtu nomads
results.creator_credit: Hermann Schlenker and International Film Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Mountain peoples of Central Asia”.
Shows an ancient game, well-known in Asia, being played by Pushtu boys. Demonstrates the toughness of the young men and the value these tribal people place on physical superiority. Suitable for upper primary and lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: Building a bridge: Tajik
results.creator_credit: Hermann Schlenker, Julien Bryan and International Film Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Mountain peoples of Central Asia”.
Shows how, in three days of actual construction, one hundred Tajik men and boys from one village work together to rebuild their hand-construction bridge. No narration.

results.title: The Legend of the pied piper

video_links.name: The Legend of the pied piper

results.brief_description: One of a series of films in which puppets are used to interpret folk legends. This film is an adaptation of the well-known fairy story of how the master musician drove the rats from the city of Hamelin.
